answer.explanation:
M1: OK, Ms. Mendez. Q1 The total cost to repaint the foyer will be around four thousand dollars.
That includes after service for six months if you have any problems with our work.
W: Hmm... That’s more expensive than I thought it would be. Our budget was three thousand dollars. Why is the price so high?
M2: Q2 I can explain why the price is over your budget. It is because the old paint is peeling badly in some areas. We have to remove it all before repainting, which takes a long time. If you had repainted it earlier it would be less expensive.
M1: In the future I would recommend painting it every 7 years.
W: OK. I thought I was being over charged, but that makes sense. Q3 You can go ahead and begin painting on the first weekend of August.

question.text: What kind of work are the men doing?
What can the man explain?
choices: (A) Why she has a low budget
(B) Why the price is above her budget
(C) Why the foyer isn’t ready to be painted

answer.text: (B) Why the price is above her budget

question.text: When does the woman want the men to begin work?

answer.explanation:
M: Ms. Franklin, here is the inventory list in case we need to order anything. Q1 Please let me know by today because the supply company is closing for Christmas soon.
W: I see. Well, Christmas is coming up so Q2 we will need to wrap a lot of gifts for the staff presents. Also, I’m tired of holding my phone while typing and we don’t have anything for me to use. Can you please order me something?
M: Yes, no problem. I will order that for you. Also, we are out of business cards and we have some new employees beginning after Christmas. Q2 I suggest we have business cards ready when they arrive, otherwise we may look unprofessional.
W: Good idea. Go ahead and order those too. Q3 Can you please send me the order form so I can double-check it before you send it away?
M: I’ll email it to you soon.

question.text: Why do they need to send the order today?
choices: (A) Because the company is closing for Christmas.
(B) Because the company is closing for New Years.
(C) The company doesn’t have the item.

answer.text: (A) Because the company is closing for Christmas.

answer.explanation:
W: Excuse me? Q1 I’m on a diet at the moment so I’m looking for some healthier food options. I like to have cereal in the morning, can you recommend something for me? My nutritionist said I should eat a lot of protein.
M: There are many different breakfast options. One of my favorites is the new Protein Plus range. It has oats, fruits, and extra protein added. Here, take a look.
W: Hmm, this looks delicious! Q2 But my nutritionist said I should keep my sugar intake below 20 grams a day. One serving of this cereal contains 28 grams!
M: Yes. In that case, Q3 I recommend that you try having eggs in the morning with some coffee. Then you can eat some sugar later in the day.

answer.explanation:
M: Hi, Q1 I’m competing in a triathlon next week and I need some energy bars or drinks to have during the race. It’s a six-hour race so it will be exhausting. I’d like something that is low in fat and will give me a boost of energy quickly.
W: Wow! That sounds exhausting. We actually have a new range of energy gels. My personal favorite is this one; it’s called Flammer Gel.
M: Oh wow! I’ve never heard of energy gels. That’s convenient. Q2 Oh, this looks great. It is basically just sugar. That’s perfect!
W: It also has caffeine which is really helpful. Our other products don’t have that. Q3 But I suggest you don’t have too much caffeine before you take this because this has quite a lot.

Fabric Price

answer.explanation:
M: Hi, I need this suit cleaned. Q1 I’m going overseas on a business trip on the weekend and all my suits are getting a bit old now. How much would it cost to clean this?
W: Hmm... Q2 Usually twenty dollars. But this one will cost a bit more.
M: Really? On your price list, it says twenty dollars.
W: Well, yes, but you’re very tall. This suit is going to take longer to clean and require more products. It will incur an additional surcharge.
M: Hmm... Maybe I will take it somewhere else. That doesn’t seem fair.
W: Q3 OK. I will do it for twenty dollars. And whenever you need a suit cleaned, please come back to me.

W: Hello, Mr. Weaver. Q1 You are one of the final applicants that we are considering for the teaching position at Belmont University. How do you think your previous jobs have prepared you to teach at our university?
M: Q2 Well, I used to be an editor-in-chief at a literary magazine. Therefore, I think it has prepared me well to teach in the English literature department at your university. I would be able to help students to become better writers.
W: Well, I think you are right about that. You seem to be qualified for the position. As you may know, we don’t pay a lot for this position. Q3 However, if you take a job with US, you would receive a lot of time off during the summer vacation.
M: Actually, that’s one of the reasons I chose this job.
